results.title: Who's Afraid of Opera?: Faust/Rigoletto
results.brief_description: On this video, Joan Sutherland performs mini-versions of Faust’ andRigoletto’. She first introduces the story of each mini-opera to her three puppet friends. Then, backed by the London Symphony Orchestra conducted by Richard Bonynge, and a first-rate cast, she moves onto the opera stage, complete with elaborate sets and elegant costumes.

results.title: Who'll pay the buffalo bill?
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Dione Gilmour
results.brief_description: Robyn Williams reports on the consequences of the introduction of water buffaloes to the Northern Territory wetlands. He discusses their impact on the environment, how they were and are hunted, their role in spreading diseases and their effect on the pet food industry and the tourist trade.

results.title: Who'll do the dirty work?
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788”.
The arrival of more than three million people since World War II has provided a vast labor force. Shows how some of these migrants have struck it rich, but many have been the first to suffer from union neglect and exploitation in low skilled work areas. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Whitlam
results.creator_credit: Lighthouse Films, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Mark Davis
results.brief_description: A biography of Edward Gough Whitlam in his three years as Prime Minister of Australia, from 1972 until 1975. The program discusses Whitlam’s government and its achievements in Australian society by supporting an independent cultural identity, challenging economic and social inequalities, and attacking the racism of white Australia as well as the failures which eventually led to his dismissal. In its examination of Whitlam’s life, his early political influences and his ascendancy to leadership of a then moribund Labor Party this documentary contemplates both the successes and failures of the government he led to power. In 1975 Whitlam was ousted from government and replaced by Malcolm Fraser at the Governor General’s direction, an unprecedented event in Australian political history. The events of 1975 have had a permanent impact on Australian political processes but Whitlam’s reputation as one of Australia’s visionary politicians, successful or otherwise, has been maintained.

results.title: Whiteys like us
results.creator_credit: Ronin Films, SBS Independent, Tom Zubrycki and Rachel Landers
results.brief_description: In 1991 a National Council for Aboriginal Reconciliation was established in Australia with the “aim of improving relations between Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and other Australians” by the year 2001. To achieve this, Study Circles were set up across Australia whereby small groups of people would come together and debate the issues over a period of eight weeks and since 1991 over 1500 Study Circles have been held throughout Australia. This documentary focuses on one such study circle which took place at the Manly Community College in 1998 where all the participants were non-indigenous Australians from Sydney’s affluent north shore. The dynamics of the group and the responses of the individuals within it reveal a lot about the current and complex state of indigenous and non-indigenous relations in Australia. The emotions expressed by the group are quite confronting particularly when David Watts (Indigenous Heritage Officer) appears as a guest speaker at one of the weekly sessions. This is a most compelling documentary on the issue of reconciliation revealing the personal struggles it would seem that most “ordinary” Australians are attempting to come to terms with.

results.title: Whitewater...and the winning combination
results.brief_description: The film uses a champion kayaker facing the rapids of the Colorado River to show how an individual must find his own winning combination to face the challenge and succeed in any field. A motivational film.

results.title: White zombie
results.creator_credit: Edward C. Halperin and Victor Halperin
results.brief_description: In this eerie, theatrically staged horror film, a young couple, Madeleine Short (Madge Bellamy) and Neil Parker (John Harron) encounter the world of voodoo and zombies in the Haitian mountains when they arrive as guests of Charles Beaumont (Robert Fraser). When their host enlists the evil powers of Muder Legende (Bela Lugosi) to place a curse on Madeleine, a series of chilling events occur.

results.title: White sails in Danish waters
results.creator_credit: Nordisk Films Kompagni, Paul Bang and Carl Otto Peterson
results.brief_description: Shows yachting in Danish waters. Tells how children and young people receive skilled instruction in the yacht clubs. We join a holiday cruise through some of Denmark’s loveliest regions, and experience a race on the sound.
